definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
arms enough to stem the stream (idiom); formidable army

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the predictive effect of classification of liver function in patients by Akoi's disconnective operation.
sentences.chinese: 目的评估肝功能分级指标对断流手术预后的预测作用。

sentences.english: A high-temperature cut-out isolates power supply to the heater .
sentences.chinese: 高温断流器切断给通往热器的电源。

sentences.english: What the maps don’t reveal is that the rivers are often only possibilities.
sentences.chinese: 这些地图没有暴露这些河流总是断流的。

sentences.english: The purpose was to help design the ideal hole radius of setting-off for quantified filling.
sentences.chinese: 本研究有助于设计理想的断流计量充填孔径。

sentences.english: Panel cut- outs shall be smooth and straight.
sentences.chinese: 断流器盘应是光滑和笔直的。

sentences.english: In particular, leaves almost no drying capacity of the pump.
sentences.chinese: 特别是叶片泵几乎没有断流能力。

sentences.english: It is also possible to integrate an asynchronous service with a non-interruptible flow.
sentences.chinese: 然而，使用不可中断流来集成异步服务也是有可能的。

definition: to pilot a ship/to channel water/to draw water (for irrigation)
to freeze over (of water or land)
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
